|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = Winbond;W632GG6KB-12; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = Wistron NeWeb DNXB-33 |rad2modif = Mini PCIe |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43520;BCM43520KMLG; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 867 |rad2n = 300 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *"48BNXB33.SGB" and "2016/03/03" are silkscreened on the back of the Mini PCIe card in the FCC photos. *"48RVRB03.0GB" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The datasheet seems to claim 802.11ac support at 2.4GHz with proprietary clients saying, "2x2:2 802.11b/g/n/ac up to 400 Mbps data rate. 802.11ac for VHT capable Proprietary clients."
This product supposedly has a Dedicated Third Radio for "2.4 & 5 GHz dual-band WIDS/WIPS, spectrum analysis & location analytics radio" not for clients.
The Real Simultaneous Dual Band (RSDB) feature of the BCM47452 may be used to enable the third radio while limiting 802.11bgn support to 1x1:1.
==Links of Interest== [https://www.mist.com/wp-content/uploads/Mist-AP21-Datasheet.pdf Datasheet]
